newsitem.title: CANADA: Imperial sees low supply impact from fire.
newsitem.headline: Imperial sees low supply impact from fire.

text.p: Imperial Oil Ltd said on Friday it expected little impact on production at its Nanticoke, Ontario refinery from a fire on Thursday.

"We don't anticipate any impact on supply of petroleum products to any of our customers as a result of this incident," Imperial spokeswoman Janet Maaten said. "We'll be continuing to run about 100,000 barrels a day."
The fire, which burned for about two hours on Thursday afternoon, was contained in the 112,000 barrel-a-day plant's catalytic cracking unit.
Maaten said the unit was expected to be back in service within a week. The cause of the blaze had yet to be determined.
The refinery, located about 100 km (62 miles) southwest of Toronto, is Imperial's third largest.
